com.characterforming.jrte

Interface IEffector<T extends ITarget>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The effector target type
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    IParameterizedEffector<T,P>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BaseEffector, BaseParameterizedEffector

    public interface IEffector<T extends ITarget>
    Interface for simple effectors. Effectors are invoked at runtime in response to state transitions in a running transduction instance. They are typically anonymous inner classes defined in ITarget.bind().
    Author:
    kb

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int RTE_EFFECT_NONE
      Return RTE_EFFECT_NONE from effector.invoke() methods that do not affect the ITransduction transducer stack or input stack.
      static int RTE_EFFECT_PAUSE
      Return RTE_EFFECT_PAUSE from an effector.invoke() method to force immediate and resumable exit from run().
      static int RTE_EFFECT_POP
      Return RTE_EFFECT_POP from effector.invoke() methods that pop the ITransduction input stack.
      static int RTE_EFFECT_PUSH
      Return RTE_EFFECT_PUSH from effector.invoke() methods that push the ITransduction input stack.
      static int RTE_EFFECT_SHIFT
      Return RTE_EFFECT_SHIFT from effector.invoke() methods that replace the top transducer on the ITransduction transducer stack.
      static int RTE_EFFECT_START
      Return RTE_EFFECT_START from effector.invoke() methods that push the ITransduction transducer stack.
      static int RTE_EFFECT_STOP
      Return RTE_EFFECT_STOP from effector.invoke() methods that pop the ITransduction transducer stack.
      static int RTE_EFFECT_STOPPED
      Return RTE_EFFECT_STOPPED from an effector.invoke() method to force immediate and final exit from run().

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getName()
      Returns the effector name.
      T getTarget()
      Returns the target that expresses the effector
      int invoke()
      This method is invoked at runtime when triggered by an input transition.

    • Method Detail

      • getTarget

        T getTarget()
        Returns the target that expresses the effector
        Returns:
        The target that expresses the effector

      • getName

        java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the effector name. The name of the effector is the token used to reference it in transducer definitions.
        Returns:
        The effector name.

      • invoke

        int invoke()
    throws EffectorException
        This method is invoked at runtime when triggered by an input transition.
        Returns:
        User-defined effectors should return 0
        Throws:
        EffectorException - On error
